metadata.title: CVE-2022-2879 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Reader.Read does not set a limit on the maximum size of file headers. Amaliciously crafted archive could cause Read to allocate unbounded amountsof memory, potentially causing resource exhaustion or panics. After fix,Reader.Read limits the maximum size of header blocks to 1 MiB.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2879` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-1.18 - 1.18.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.6
golang-1.18-go - 1.18.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.6
golang-1.18-src - 1.18.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.6
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

golang-1.13 - 1.13.8-1ubuntu1~16.04.3+esm3
golang-1.13-go - 1.13.8-1ubuntu1~16.04.3+esm3
golang-1.13-src - 1.13.8-1ubuntu1~16.04.3+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: golang-1.18 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.18.1-1ubuntu1~16.04.6').
golang-1.13 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.13.8-1ubuntu1~16.04.3+esm3').
golang-1.10 package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
golang-1.6 package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
